author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
Part of https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2123

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @lzybkr that's a good question about whether we even want this cmdlet.  I've never used it until I wrote tests for it.  @ffeldhaus opened the original issue and had this in the list.  Personally, I'm fine either way.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Could you please review WriteError()'s in `update-list.cs` and add tests?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I found 45 results in GitHub https://github.com/search?q=%22Update-List%22+language%3APowerShell&type=Code&utf8=%E2%9C%93 - somebody still use this cmdlet!!!

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov you have to exclude the .psd1 (which is just copies of Utility.psd1) and any results from PowerShell/* repos or forks of PowerShell/PowerShell.  So there's really less than 20 hits and many of them are for the same factorial script and a number are for a custom function called `Update-List`.  Seems like good justification to just remove this code.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I agree. I can't think of PowerShell magic scenarios that are impossible without this cmdlet.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee agreed that this is not likely a highly used cmdlet and we can defer bringing it back until we hear customer feedback leaving the disabled code where it is for now

title: enable Update-List cmdlet
